M0.description: Master 0 Priority. Sets the arbitration priority for this port on the associated slave port.

M1.description: Master 1 Priority. Sets the arbitration priority for this port on the associated slave port.

M2.description: Master 2 Priority. Sets the arbitration priority for this port on the associated slave port.

M3.description: Master 3 Priority. Sets the arbitration priority for this port on the associated slave port.

M4.description: Master 4 Priority. Sets the arbitration priority for this port on the associated slave port.

M5.description: Master 5 Priority. Sets the arbitration priority for this port on the associated slave port.

M6.description: Master 6 Priority. Sets the arbitration priority for this port on the associated slave port.

M7.description: Master 7 Priority. Sets the arbitration priority for this port on the associated slave port.

TCD%s_NBYTES_MLOFFYES.description: TCD Signed Minor Loop Offset (Minor Loop and Offset Enabled)

TCD%s_NBYTES_MLOFFNO.description: TCD Signed Minor Loop Offset (Minor Loop Enabled and Offset Disabled)

TCD%s_NBYTES_MLNO.description: TCD Minor Byte Count (Minor Loop Disabled)

TCD%s_CITER_ELINKYES.description: TCD Current Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Enabled)

TCD%s_CITER_ELINKNO.description: TCD Current Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Disabled)

TCD%s_DLASTSGA.description: TCD Last Destination Address Adjustment/Scatter Gather Address

TCD%s_BITER_ELINKYES.description: TCD Beginning Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Enabled)

TCD%s_BITER_ELINKNO.description: TCD Beginning Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Disabled)

ERRCHN.description: Error Channel Number or Cancelled Channel Number

SAST.description: Set All START Bits (activates all channels)

DPA.description: Disable preempt ability. This bit resets to zero.

ECP.description: Enable Channel Preemption. This bit resets to zero.

MLOFF.description: If SMLOE or DMLOE is set, this field represents a sign-extended offset applied to the source or destination address to form the next-state value after the minor loop completes.

ELINK.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on minor-loop complete
Enable channel-to-channel linking on minor-loop complete

INTMAJOR.description: Enable an interrupt when major iteration count completes

INTHALF.description: Enable an interrupt when major counter is half complete.

MAJORELINK.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on major loop complete

ELINK.description: Enables channel-to-channel linking on minor loop complete
Enables channel-to-channel linking on minor loop complete

CSPMCR.description: Chip select port multiplexing control register

EAR%s.description: Error Address Register, Slave Port n

EDR%s.description: Error Detail Register, Slave Port n

RGDAAC%s.description: Region Descriptor Alternate Access Control n

M0UM.description: Bus master 0 user mode access control

M0SM.description: Bus master 0 supervisor mode access control

M1UM.description: Bus master 1 user mode access control

M1SM.description: Bus master 1 supervisor mode access control

M2UM.description: Bus master 2 user mode access control

M2SM.description: Bus master 2 supervisor mode access control

M3UM.description: Bus master 3 user mode access control

M3SM.description: Bus master 3 supervisor mode access control

M0UM.description: Bus master 0 user mode access control

M0SM.description: Bus master 0 supervisor mode access control

M1UM.description: Bus master 1 user mode access control

M1SM.description: Bus master 1 supervisor mode access control

M2UM.description: Bus master 2 user mode access control

M2SM.description: Bus master 2 supervisor mode access control

M3UM.description: Bus master 3 user mode access control

M3SM.description: Bus master 3 supervisor mode access control

MGSTAT0.description: Memory Controller Command Completion Status Flag

MAXMB.description: Number of the Last Message Buffer

IRMQ.description: Individual Rx Masking and Queue Enable

BUF5I.description: Buffer MB5 Interrupt or "Frames available in Rx FIFO"

BUF6I.description: Buffer MB6 Interrupt or "Rx FIFO Warning"

BUF7I.description: Buffer MB7 Interrupt or "Rx FIFO Overflow"

EACEN.description: Entire Frame Arbitration Field Comparison Enable for Rx Mailboxes

WRMFRZ.description: Write-Access to Memory in Freeze mode

TIME_STAMP.description: Free-Running Counter Time stamp. This 16-bit field is a copy of the Free-Running Timer, captured for Tx and Rx frames at the time when the beginning of the Identifier field appears on the CAN bus.

DLC.description: Length of the data to be stored/transmitted.

RTR.description: Remote Transmission Request. One/zero for remote/data frame.

IDE.description: ID Extended. One/zero for extended/standard format frame.

SRR.description: Substitute Remote Request. Contains a fixed recessive bit.

EXT.description: Contains extended (LOW word) identifier of message buffer.

STD.description: Contains standard/extended (HIGH word) identifier of message buffer.

PRIO.description: Local priority. This 3-bit fieldis only used when LPRIO_EN bit is set in MCR and it only makes sense for Tx buffers. These bits are not transmitted. They are appended to the regular ID to define the transmission priority.

CTAR_SLAVE.description: DSPI Clock and Transfer Attributes Register (In Slave Mode)

CTAR%s.description: DSPI Clock and Transfer Attributes Register (In Master Mode)

RSER.description: DSPI DMA/Interrupt Request Select and Enable Register

PUSHR.description: DSPI PUSH TX FIFO Register In Master Mode

PUSHR_SLAVE.description: DSPI PUSH TX FIFO Register In Slave Mode

PCSIS.description: Peripheral Chip Select x Inactive State

RFDF_DIRS.description: Receive FIFO Drain DMA or Interrupt Request Select.

TFFF_DIRS.description: Transmit FIFO Fill DMA or Interrupt Request Select

CRCLL.description: CRCLL stores the first 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

CRCL.description: CRCL stores the lower 16 bits of the 16/32 bit CRC

CRCLU.description: CRCLL stores the second 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

CRCHL.description: CRCHL stores the third 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

CRCH.description: CRCH stores the high 16 bits of the 16/32 bit CRC

CRCHU.description: CRCHU stores the fourth 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

GPOLYLL.description: POLYLL stores the first 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

GPOLYL.description: POLYL stores the lower 16 bits of the 16/32 bit CRC polynomial value

GPOLYLU.description: POLYLL stores the second 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

GPOLYH.description: POLYH stores the high 16 bits of the 16/32 bit CRC polynomial value

GPOLYHL.description: POLYHL stores the third 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

GPOLYHU.description: POLYHU stores the fourth 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

WAS.description: Write CRC data register as seed

FXOR.description: Complement Read of CRC data register

GPTIMER%sLD.description: General Purpose Timer n Load Register

GPTIMER%sCTL.description: General Purpose Timer n Control Register

HCIVERSION.description: Host Controller Interface Version and Capability Registers Length Register

PERIODICLISTBASE.description: Periodic Frame List Base Address Register

BURSTSIZE.description: Master Interface Data Burst Size Register

RESERVED.description: This register is not defined in the EHCI specification. Every device implements endpoint 0 as a control endpoint.

STM.description: Scan Trigger Mode. This bit-field can only be changed if the TSI module is disabled (TSIEN bit = 0).

TSIIE.description: Touch Sensing Input Interrupt Module Enable

OVRF.description: Overrun error Flag. This flag is set when a scan trigger occurs while a scan is still in progress. Writing "1" to this bit will clear the flag to 0.

NSCN.description: Number of Consecutive Scans per Electrode electrode.

LPSCNITV.description: TSI Low Power Mode Scan Interval.

LPCLKS.description: Low Power Mode Clock Source Selection.

USSWE.description: USB voltage regulator stop standby write enable

DDRPEN.description: Pin enable for all DDR I/O

STCTRLL.description: Watchdog Status and Control Register Low

CGL1.description: CMT Carrier Generator Low Data Register 1

CGL2.description: CMT Carrier Generator Low Data Register 2

LOLIE1.description: PLL1 Loss of Lock Interrupt Enable

SMB.description: I2C SMBus Control and Status register

SLTL.description: I2C SCL Low Timeout Register Low

PCTL.description: UART CEA709.1-B Packet Cycle Time Counter Low

SDTL.description: UART CEA709.1-B Secondary Delay Timer Low

RIE.description: Receiver Full Interrupt or DMA Transfer Enable

LVDSC1.description: Low Voltage Detect Status and Control 1 Register

LVDSC2.description: Low Voltage Detect Status and Control 2 Register

AVLLS.description: Allow very low leakage stop mode

LPWUI.description: Low Power Wake Up on Interrupt

RSTFLTSRW.description: Reset pin filter select in run and wait modes

RSTFLTSS.description: Reset pin filter select in stop mode

RSTFLTSEL.description: Reset pin filter bus clock select

BYTE3.description: Third command byte that may be sent to the flash device

BYTE2.description: Second command byte that may be sent to the flash device

BUFNO.description: Internal buffer number used for this command

BYTE1.description: First command byte that may be sent to the flash device

INC1.description: Increment for the first byte of row address

INC2.description: Increment for the second byte of row address

INC3.description: Increment for the third byte of row address

ID4.description: Fourth byte returned by read ID command

ID3.description: Third byte returned by read ID command

ID2.description: Second byte returned by read ID command

ID1.description: First byte returned by read ID command

STATUS1.description: Byte returned by read status command

ID5.description: Fifth byte returned by read ID command

ADDRESS.description: DMA channel 1 address. DMA channel 1 address, it is 8-byte aligned.

OFFSET2.description: 256-byte offset for DMA channel 2. DMA channel 2 transfer starts at this offset count x 256 bytes. For example, if OFFSET2 = 0x2, DMA channel 2 transfer starts at 0x200.

COUNT2.description: Number of bytes to be transferred by DMA channel 2. It should be multiple of 8 bytes.

COUNT1.description: Number of bytes to be transferred by DMA channel 1. It should be multiple of 8 bytes.

SIZE.description: Size in bytes of one elementary transfer unit

PAGECNT.description: Number of virtual pages (in one physical flash page) to be programmed or read, etc.

IDCNT.description: Number of bytes that are read for the read id command.

FAST.description: See the "Fast Flash Configuration for EDO" section for more details.

ECCAD.description: Byte address in SRAM where ECC status is written.

ADDRESS.description: DMA channel 2 address. DMA channel 2 address, it is 8-byte aligned.

TCPD.description: Time Clock Enable to Precharge Delay

R2WSMCS.description: Read To Write Same Chip Select

W2RSMCS.description: Write To Read Same Chip Select

PDNCS.description: OCD Pull Down adjustment Chip Select

PUPCS.description: OCD Pull Up adjustment Chip Select

CLKDISCS.description: DRAM Clock Disable for chip select

SPARE_DLY_CTRL.description: These SPARE_DLY_CTRL[3:0]bits set the delay chains in the spare logic.

PAD_ODT_CS0.description: Required to enable ODT and configure ODT resistor value in the pad.

WECINT.description: Wakeup Event Enable On Card Interrupt

WECINS.description: Wakeup Event Enable On SD Card Insertion

WECRM.description: Wakeup Event Enable On SD Card Removal

CEBESEN.description: Command End Bit Error Status Enable

DEBESEN.description: Data End Bit Error Status Enable

CEBEIEN.description: Command End Bit Error Interrupt Enable

DEBEIEN.description: Data End Bit Error Interrupt Enable

CNIBAC12E.description: Command Not Issued By Auto CMD12 Error

AC12NE.description: Force Event Auto Command 12 Not Executed

AC12TOE.description: Force Event Auto Command 12 Time Out Error

AC12CE.description: Force Event Auto Command 12 CRC Error

AC12EBE.description: Force Event Auto Command 12 End Bit Error

AC12IE.description: Force Event Auto Command 12 Index Error

CNIBAC12E.description: Force Event Command Not Executed By Auto Command 12 Error

CTOE.description: Force Event Command Time Out Error

CEBE.description: Force Event Command End Bit Error

DTOE.description: Force Event Data Time Out Error

DEBE.description: Force Event Data End Bit Error

ADMAES.description: ADMA Error State (when ADMA Error is occurred.)

EXBLKNU.description: Exact block number block read enable for SDIO CMD53

DTOCVACK.description: Boot ACK time out counter value.

LCWHB.description: LCDC cursor width, height, and blink register

LGWSAR.description: LCDC graphic window start address register

LGWVPWR.description: LCDC graphic window virtual page width register

LGWPOR.description: LCDC graphic window panning offset register

LGWDCR.description: LCDC graphic window DMA control register

LAUSCCR.description: LCDC AUS mode cursor control register

SSA.description: Screen start address of LCD panel

H_WAIT_2.description: Wait between HSYNC and start of next line

GW_BOF_EN.description: Graphic window beginning of frame interrupt enable

GW_EOF_EN.description: Graphic window end of frame interrupt enable

GW_UDR_ERR_EN.description: Graphic window under run error interrupt enable

GWSA.description: Graphic window start address on LCD screen

GWCKB.description: Graphic window color keying blue component

GWCKG.description: Graphic window color keying green component

GWCKR.description: Graphic window color keying red component

AGWCKB.description: AUS graphic window color keying blue component

AGWCKG.description: AUS graphic window color keying green component

AGWCKR.description: AUS graphic window color keying red component

TDSR.description: Transmit Buffer Descriptor Ring Start Register

RMON_T_DROP.description: Count of frames not counted correctly (RMON_T_DROP). NOTE: Counter not implemented (read 0 always) as not applicable.

RMON_T_CRC_ALIGN.description: RMON Tx Packets w CRC/Align error (RMON_T_CRC_ALIGN)

RMON_T_UNDERSIZE.description: RMON Tx Packets < 64 bytes, good CRC (RMON_T_UNDERSIZE)

RMON_T_OVERSIZE.description: RMON Tx Packets > MAX_FL bytes, good CRC (RMON_T_OVERSIZE)

RMON_T_FRAG.description: RMON Tx Packets < 64 bytes, bad CRC (RMON_T_FRAG)

RMON_T_JAB.description: RMON Tx Packets > MAX_FL bytes, bad CRC (RMON_T_JAB)

IEEE_T_DROP.description: Count of frames not counted correctly (IEEE_T_DROP). NOTE: Counter not implemented (read 0 always) as not applicable.

IEEE_T_MACERR.description: Frames Transmitted with Tx FIFO Underrun (IEEE_T_MACERR)

IEEE_T_CSERR.description: Frames Transmitted with Carrier Sense Error (IEEE_T_CSERR)

IEEE_T_SQE.description: Frames Transmitted with SQE Error (IEEE_T_SQE). NOTE: Counter not implemented (read 0 always) as no SQE information is available.

IEEE_T_OCTETS_OK.description: Octet count for Frames Transmitted w/o Error (IEEE_T_OCTETS_OK). NOTE: Counts total octets (includes header and FCS fields).

RMON_R_CRC_ALIGN.description: RMON Rx Packets w CRC/Align error (RMON_R_CRC_ALIGN)

RMON_R_UNDERSIZE.description: RMON Rx Packets < 64 bytes, good CRC (RMON_R_UNDERSIZE)

RMON_R_OVERSIZE.description: RMON Rx Packets > MAX_FL bytes, good CRC (RMON_R_OVERSIZE)

RMON_R_FRAG.description: RMON Rx Packets < 64 bytes, bad CRC (RMON_R_FRAG)

RMON_R_JAB.description: RMON Rx Packets > MAX_FL bytes, bad CRC (RMON_R_JAB)

IEEE_R_DROP.description: Count of frames not counted correctly (IEEE_R_DROP). NOTE: Counter increments if a frame with valid/missing SFD character is detected and has been dropped. None of the other counters increments if this counter increments.

IEEE_R_OCTETS_OK.description: Octet count for Frames Rcvd w/o Error (IEEE_R_OCTETS_OK). Counts total octets (includes header and FCS fields).

PROM.description: Promiscuous mode. All frames are accepted regardless of address matching.

PADEN.description: Enable frame padding remove on receive

ADDSEL.description: Source MAC address select on transmit

CRCFWD.description: Forward frame from application with CRC

RX_SECTION_FULL.description: Value of receive FIFO section full threshold

RX_SECTION_EMPTY.description: Value of the receive FIFO section empty threshold

RX_ALMOST_EMPTY.description: Value of the receive FIFO almost empty threshold

RX_ALMOST_FULL.description: Value of the receive FIFO almost full threshold

TX_SECTION_EMPTY.description: Value of the transmit FIFO section empty threshold

TX_ALMOST_EMPTY.description: Value of transmit FIFO almost empty threshold

TX_ALMOST_FULL.description: Value of the transmit FIFO almost full threshold

PADREM.description: Enable padding removal for short IP frames.

IPDIS.description: Enable discard of frames with wrong IPv4 header checksum.

PRODIS.description: Enable discard of frames with wrong protocol checksum

LINEDIS.description: Enable discard of frames with MAC layer errors

INC.description: Clock period of the timestamping clock (ts_clk) in nanoseconds

TF0.description: Copy of Timer Flag for channel 0

TF1.description: Copy of Timer Flag for channel 1

TF2.description: Copy of Timer Flag for channel 2

TF3.description: Copy of Timer Flag for channel 3

DACBFRPBF.description: DAC buffer read pointer bottom position flag

DACBFRPTF.description: DAC buffer read pointer top position flag

DACBBIEN.description: DAC buffer read pointer bottom flag interrupt enable

DACBTIEN.description: DAC buffer read pointer top flag interrupt enable

ASC.description: Each bit in the ASC field indicates whether there is a corresponding connection to the crossbar switch's slave input port.

AMC.description: Each bit in the AMC field indicates whether there is a corresponding connection to the AXBS master input port.
